channel.title: [317] [Delta] Clipping NPCs?
channel.description:
Hello Moparians, PsychoScapeRSPS here. I have a question...Whenever I attack an NPC, it walks through all walls/gates/objects that would be impassible in RuneScape 2.
Can this be fixed?
Is it a problem with the NPC or my objects?
Many Thanks, PsychoScapeRSPS

item.title: [317] [Delta] Clipping NPCs?
item.dc:creator: @PsychoScapeRSPS PsychoScapeRSPS
item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:10, topic:426244”][quote author=PsychoScapeRSPS link=topic=528934.msg3858524#msg3858524 date=1324514757]

would this work well?

Perhaps, but I can tell just by looking at it that It’s from a tutorial. If you implement that, then you’ll need to find the coordinates you wish to clip using:

tiles.put(0 << 28 | #### << 14 | ####, true);

Also, with your experience, you shouldn’t be worrying about Clipping.

Also, with your experience, you shouldn’t be worrying about Clipping.
Probably true :sadface:
[/quote]

Trust me, I know what I’m talking about. You may add my Skype and ask me for help: SpecialAgentJackBower

Just don’t ask me to do things for you.[/quote]
Okay, thank you very much Anything you help with me with, I’ll give you credits in my source.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] [Delta] Clipping NPCs?
item.dc:creator: @PsychoScapeRSPS PsychoScapeRSPS
item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

would this work well?
Purpose:
To fix NPC’s walking through walls.

Tutorial:
Create a new Java Class called WalkingCheck and put this inside it:

Code:
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.HashMap;

public class WalkingCheck
{
public static void check(){
tiles.put(0 << 28 | 2604 << 14 | 3099, true);
}

public static Map<Integer, Boolean> tiles = new HashMap<Integer, Boolean>();

}
Then make a new Java Class file called Tile and paste this in it:

Code:
public class Tile
{
public Tile(int x, int y){
setX(x);
setY(y);
}

public Tile(int x, int y, int h){
	setX(x);
	setY(y);
	setH(h);
}

public Tile(int x, int y, int h, int f){
	setX(x);
	setY(y);
	setH(h);
	setF(f);
}

public void setX(int x){
	this.x = x;
}

public void setY(int y){
	this.y = y;
}

public void setH(int h){
	this.h = h;
}

public void setF(int f){
	this.f = f;
}

public int getX() {
	return x;
}

public int getY() {
	return y;
}

public int getH() {
	return h;
}

public int getF() {
	return f;
}

private int x = -1;
private int y = -1;
private int h = -1;
private int f = -1;

}
Then go to the NPC class and declare this variable:

Code:
private Tile currentTile;
Then Search for the method “getNextWalkingDirection()” and replace it with:

Code:
public int getNextWalkingDirection() {
currentTile = new Tile(absX + moveX, absY + moveY, heightLevel);
if(!WalkingCheck.tiles.containsKey(currentTile.getH() << 28 | currentTile.getX() << 14 | currentTile.getY())){
int dir;
dir = misc.direction(absX, absY, (absX + moveX), (absY + moveY));
if (dir == -1)
return -1;
dir >>= 1;
absX += moveX;
absY += moveY;
return dir;
} else if(WalkingCheck.tiles.get(currentTile.getH() << 28 | currentTile.getX() << 14 | currentTile.getY()) == true) {
return -1;
} else {
return -1;
}
}
In the server Class add this right under the “main(String)” method:

Code:
WalkingCheck.check();
That should do it. To add more Unwalkable Tiles:

In WalkingCheck Class, you’ll see:

Code:
public static void check(){
tiles.put(2604 * 3099, true);
}
Add more by putting another:

Code:
tiles.put(X_COORD * Y_COORD, true);
under

Code:
tiles.put(2604 * 3099, true);
where X_COORD is the absolute X coordinate and Y_COORD is the absolute Y coordinate.

Would that work well?

Read full topic

item.title: [317] [Delta] Clipping NPCs?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“PsychoScapeRSPS, post:5, topic:426244”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=528934.msg3858481#msg3858481 date=1324513067]
The problem lies neither with your NPCs or your Objects. Yes, it can be fixed/added, I’ve implemented it into my source. However, I don’t recommend that you clip the entire world map, as it will cause lag and issues unless done properly. You should do it so that you add the coordinates you want clipped.
[/quote]Thanks but how do I add in a clipping command?[/quote]

It isn’t a clipping command. It’s more complicated than just posting a simple fix in the Help section. Also, I’m not the one to ask for this. I’m not going to release or give my Clipping/Pathfinding to anyone.

Read full topic

However, I don’t recommend that you clip the entire world map, as it will cause lag and issues unless done properly. You should do it so that you add the coordinates you want clipped.
